so in other words if this goose is

and and finally we have to decide does

and we use simple rather than compound

with high accuracy and low latency has
two core technical challenges that we've

the tolerance for error in data is

the second challenge we have that why

so taking a peek at this library this
first performs some transformations of

and examples of this might include like

then get passed into various sets of

over 18 you'll notice that we've

going to go too much into that in this
talk
so once we run all these policies then
we get a final decision and we take that

that went into the decision all of the

data and then all of the policy results
that the intermediate policy results
that resulted in the final decision and
then these logs get periodically rotated
to s3 where they can be consumed by
other pieces of our system that I'll
talk about
so with this architecture in place we
were able to build a code verification
system that reads these logs and feeds
the raw data into the exact same library

so again this separation between the IO
of the service and the logic of the

to test new versions of the library
against real production data that was
used for for previous production
decisions and the output of this system

describe differences in the decisions

and what actually happened on production
so this includes signal value changes
and in in the signal report and then

before the new code lands in production

related data challenges that we've had
to deal with working on machine learning
models in this area so here's a
high-level overview of a typical
supervised machine learning system we
have some labeled data that comes from
elsewhere in our system that we use to
train models these models are deployed
to production where they're used to make
predictions about new unlabeled data in
our case this happens within our web
service whenever we need to make some
kind of risk decision and so a typical
problem that can arise in these systems
is called training serving skew so for
these models to work it's critical that
the features use when training the model
are exactly the same as the features
that we use when we make predictions
about new data
a related problem that also occurs when
you have some time delay before you get
labels for your data for example if
you're waiting for a loan to be repaid
is when information from the future
leaks into your training data this is a
problem because it lets the model
effectively cheat at training time which
may cause it to learn the wrong effects
from the data for example if repayment
data from the loan that you're currently
underwriting is somehow included in
certain features then the model may
overestimate the importance of those
features so one possible solution to
both of these problems is to log the
features that go into the model whenever
you make prediction and then we can use
those log features to train new versions
of the model this effectively guarantees
that you don't have any data from the
future making it into your training set
and it also gives you some assurance
that the way you derive those features
for training is the same as when you
derive those features for making
predictions it's still possible however
that the logic you use to extract those
features changes over time there might
be some drift so to protect ourselves
against this we can actually use that
verification system which I just
described where instead of signals we're
now just dealing with features of our
machine learning model but this strategy
presents another problem how do we add
new features to the training set so for
example suppose we discover some
correlation between the velocity at
which users are taking out loans and
repayment how can we incorporate that
information as a feature in our model
with this approach if we didn't include
those features and log them when we
originally made the predictions for
those loans this is also known as the
back fill problem where we don't have
log features for a particular training
sample but we still want some particular
point in time accurate teachers that are
consistent with how new samples will be
feature eyes for future predictions so
this diagram shows how a training set

to add new features
the training set and log it log them
with those samples but we need some

and again signals now are just the

this lets us run the exact same feature

again giving us some confidence that we

only the parts of the decision log from

another feature that we get for free
